content:
I only just noticed that the anchor part of a bors link is slightly wrong now:

The latest upstream changes (presumably #xxxxx) made this pull request unmergeable. Please resolve the merge conflicts.

It should link to #rebasing-and-conflicts instead of #conflicts (which no longer exists).

(I wasn't sure where to report bors issues so I've put it in general)

looks like maybe the homu repository? at least i think that's where the production code comes from.
https://github.com/rust-lang/homu/blob/master/homu/main.py#L1554-L1559
but yeah, reporting here seems fine as a first step; #t-infra might be the people who would actually deploy such a change (if it doesn't auto-deploy)?
